Message:
That day, my commander—
the aristocrat that stood
at the top of our troop—
called me to headquarters.

“Are there any legends passed
down in your hometown?”

I thought it a strange question,
but answered nonetheless.

“My hometown is said to
have been founded by a witch.”

My village was attacked
by the troop a few days later.

When I realized it,
it was too late.

When I rushed to the village,
my eyes were greeted by
smoky pillars of flames,

dead bodies piled on top of
one another, and soldiers
crudely laughing at it all.

Their eyes met mine,
their weapons at the ready.
It seems I’m the last survivor.
